page.title: 06New Shopping Complex, Corby
page.content: A multi-million pound shopping, leisure hotel and office complex that when complete could create 1200 new jobs in Corby is planned to get under way in the second half of 1985. To be built on the cleared site of the steel- works the thirty to fifty million pound development is a combined operation by local agents, architects, builders, surveyors and the Corby District Council. The new centre will be made up of a superstore, DIY warehouse, furniture\ carpet store, twelve shopping units, offices, a public house and restaurant, a garden centre, a hotel and conference centre, a petrol station and an entertainment complex. The first phase costing ten million has just been started with a view to opening an Asda hypermarket before Christmas next year. A new road to the site is complete.
